availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, soldier. New York City, New York native. Traveled on the Louisville and Nashville, Kentucky in a U.S. Army capacity in December 1862, Oil cloth maker in 1864. Served as private in the 23rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry from January 5, 1864 to April 11, 1865. Discharged at Louisville, Kentucky April 11, 1865 on account of disability.

ab.bibl:
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 491.
KYR-0002-222-0043
